page.title: 01DUNDONALD AREA _ SUMMARY
page.content: Our area,midway between the towns of Troon and Kilmarnock,is made up mostly of farmland. The land is mainly used for rough grazing. There are 16 farms in the area. The centre of population is the village of{DUNDONALD,}population about 3000. {Places of interest_ {Dundonald Castle}_ Built in 13th Century. Seat of Scottish King, Robert the Second. Well preserved vaulted stone roof. {Dundonald Parish Church _}Interesting graveyard with very old graves. {Dankeith House _}Pleasant old estate house. Wartime meeting place of Churchill,Montgomery and Eisenhower. Now a caravan site with heated,outdoor swimming pool. {Pictish or Roman Fort and various {other sites of archaeological interest
